{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3636043,"name":"Sterling","username":"Sterling01","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-26T15:53:09.716Z","cooked":"

I‚Äôm having a problem. I‚Äôm trying to program my robot with Python. When I upload the code, everything works fine, but when I try it with the driver station, I get a COMM error. What can I do?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-05-26T15:53:09.716Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":152,"readers_count":151,"score":90.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502402,"topic_slug":"roborio-comm-error","display_username":"Sterling","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71000,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/roborio-comm-error/502402/1","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3636052,"name":"","username":"borasy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/57b2e6/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-26T16:17:34.292Z","cooked":"

Hi, can you please ensure that your team number is correctly set in the Driver Station? You can find and modify the current team number in the settings menu of the application.

If it still doesn‚Äôt work, feel free to share the error message so others can help you out

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-05-26T16:17:34.292Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":152,"readers_count":151,"score":75.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502402,"topic_slug":"roborio-comm-error","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68731,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/roborio-comm-error/502402/2","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3636164,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-26T18:45:04.185Z","cooked":"

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-05-26T18:45:04.185Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":116,"readers_count":115,"score":58.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":502402,"topic_slug":"roborio-comm-error","display_username":"Dustin Spicuzza","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/software/vscode-overview/viewing-console-output.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Viewing Console Output ‚Äî FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":2}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-comm-error/502402/3","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3636290,"name":"Sterling","username":"Sterling01","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-26T20:58:19.973Z","cooked":"

When uploading the code to the robot it shows that it was uploaded correctly, but when opening the driver station the robot code is disabled and the robot shows a red light on the COMM. I would like to know what to do to solve it please.

I leave the code for better understanding

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Copyright (c) 2017-2018 FIRST. All Rights Reserved.

Open Source Software - may be modified and shared by FRC teams. The code

must be accompanied by the FIRST BSD license file in the root directory of

the project.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

import rev
import wpilib
from wpilib.drive import DifferentialDrive

class Robot(wpilib.TimedRobot):
def robotInit(self):
# SPARK MAX controllers are intialized over CAN by constructing a
# CANSparkMax object
#
# The CAN ID, which can be configured using the SPARK MAX Client, is passed
# as the first parameter
#
# The motor type is passed as the second parameter.
# Motor type can either be:
# rev.CANSparkMax.MotorType.kBrushless
# rev.CANSparkMax.MotorType.kBrushed
#
# The example below initializes four brushless motors with CAN IDs
# 1, 2, 3, 4. Change these parameters to match your setup
self.leftLeadMotor = rev.CANSparkMax(1, rev.CANSparkMax.MotorType.kBrushless)
self.leftFollowMotor = rev.CANSparkMax(2, rev.CANSparkMax.MotorType.kBrushless)
self.rightLeadMotor = rev.CANSparkMax(3, rev.CANSparkMax.MotorType.kBrushless)
self.rightFollowMotor = rev.CANSparkMax(4, rev.CANSparkMax.MotorType.kBrushless)

    # Passing in the lead motors into DifferentialDrive allows any
    # commmands sent to the lead motors to be sent to the follower motors.
    self.driveTrain = DifferentialDrive(self.leftLeadMotor, self.rightLeadMotor)
    self.joystick = wpilib.Joystick(0)

    # The RestoreFactoryDefaults method can be used to reset the
    # configuration parameters in the SPARK MAX to their factory default
    # state. If no argument is passed, these parameters will not persist
    # between power cycles
    self.leftLeadMotor.restoreFactoryDefaults()
    self.rightLeadMotor.restoreFactoryDefaults()
    self.leftFollowMotor.restoreFactoryDefaults()
    self.rightFollowMotor.restoreFactoryDefaults()

    # In CAN mode, one SPARK MAX can be configured to follow another. This
    # is done by calling the follow() method on the SPARK MAX you want to
    # configure as a follower, and by passing as a parameter the SPARK MAX
    # you want to configure as a leader.
    #
    # This is shown in the example below, where one motor on each side of
    # our drive train is configured to follow a lead motor.
    self.leftLeadMotor.setInverted(True)
    self.leftFollowMotor.follow(self.leftLeadMotor, invert=True)
    self.rightFollowMotor.follow(self.rightLeadMotor, invert=True)

def teleopPeriodic(self):
    # Drive with arcade style
    y = self.joystick.getRawAxis(1)
    x = self.joystick.getRawAxis(0)
    .driveTrain.arcadeDrive(-y, -x)

if name == ‚Äúmain‚Äù:
wpilib.run(Robot)est

Welcome to Chiefdelphi. I merged both threads you created because they are about the same issue. This helps everyone trying to help see all the information. In particular, virtuald gave you advice on how to see any error messages that the code spits out when running on the roboRIO by viewing the console that you might have missed by starting a new thread.

You can enclose code in triple back-ticks (```) to avoid formatting issues. Even better is to use GitHub or another version control system and post the link to your code.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-05-27T16:03:51.064Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":58,"readers_count":57,"score":11.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":502402,"topic_slug":"roborio-comm-error","display_username":"Sterling","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":65,"username":"Joe_Ross","name":"Joe Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71000,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/roborio-comm-error/502402/6","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3637060,"name":"Sterling","username":"Sterling01","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-27T17:22:45.696Z","cooked":"

When uploading the Python code using PyCharm, the code shows the message ‚ÄòSUCCESS: Deploy was successful‚Äô but when uploading to the driver station, it says No robot code, and the roboRIO shows a red light in the COMM section.

I would like to know how I could solve this problem. I would appreciate it very much.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-05-27T17:22:45.696Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":54,"readers_count":53,"score":15.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":502402,"topic_slug":"roborio-comm-error","display_username":"Sterling","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":71000,"username":"Sterling01","name":"Sterling","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/e19b73/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71000,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/roborio-comm-error/502402/7","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3637090,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-27T18:04:40.899Z","cooked":"
virtuald:

Assuming that your driver station can connect to the robot, the console viewer is the next place to look for error messages: Viewing Console Output ‚Äî FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

The console output will contain error messages that should help you figure out what‚Äôs wrong.

You can also run the code in simulation via robotpy sim, and that can help too.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-05-27T18:04:40.899Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":48,"readers_count":47,"score":24.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":502402,"topic_slug":"roborio-comm-error","display_username":"Dustin Spicuzza","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":71000,"username":"Sterling01","name":"Sterling","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/e19b73/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-comm-error/502402/8","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3637095,"name":"billbo911","username":"billbo911","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billbo911/{size}/110890_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-27T18:12:11.781Z","cooked":"

An ‚ÄúAI‚Äù answer to the symptoms you describe is as follows:

In FRC, a red ‚ÄúCOMM‚Äù (communications) indicator on the Driver Station signifies that the Driver Station is not communicating with the robot or other devices it‚Äôs supposed to control. This indicates a problem with the network connection, such as a lost connection, a problem with the robot‚Äôs code, or an issue with the driver station itself.

Troubleshooting Steps:

  1. 1. Check Network Connections:

Ensure the network cables are securely connected between the Driver Station, the roboRIO (or other control system), and any other devices involved.

  1. 2. Verify Driver Station Settings:

Ensure the Driver Station is configured correctly with the correct team number and network settings.

  1. 3. Restart Driver Station:

Sometimes, a simple restart can resolve temporary glitches.

  1. 4. Check Robot Code:

Make sure the robot code is running and properly configured to communicate with the Driver Station.

  1. 5. Inspect roboRIO:

If the roboRIO LED indicator is also red, it might indicate a more serious hardware issue.

  1. 6. Use the Driver Station Diagnostics:

The Diagnostics tab in the Driver Station provides detailed information about communication status, including ping status and messages, which can help pinpoint the cause of the problem.

  1. 7. Consult the Driver Station Documentation:

Refer to the official WPILib documentation for more specific troubleshooting steps and error codes.

My bet is that the DS may not be configured properly for your team #, or your code does not include you team #, or both.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-05-27T18:12:11.781Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":49,"readers_count":48,"score":24.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":502402,"topic_slug":"roborio-comm-error","display_username":"billbo911","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4760,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"KN6MPS, WRWZ842"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-comm-error/502402/9","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3637227,"name":"Nathan Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-27T19:53:18.952Z","cooked":"

Hook up your roboRIO using USB, go to the setting tab on your DS and on team number field type in 172.22.11.2. See if you could get comm this way.

If you could see communication go green but than go red than go green, repeatedly, you had a code crash.

I myself had a computer that the DS never connect to roborio via team number and I had to type in roboRIO ip address onto DS every time. The root cause of this is that computer have more than 5 ethernet adaptor (two wired, one wirelsss, serval virtual machine) that can‚Äôt be disabled and that overwhelmed mDNS.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-05-27T19:53:58.596Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":30,"readers_count":29,"score":36.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":502402,"topic_slug":"roborio-comm-error","display_username":"Nathan Zhou","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66330,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Fennekinü¶ä is so cute!"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-comm-error/502402/10","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3637425,"name":"","username":"EmerqldWither","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/emerqldwither/{size}/226176_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-27T22:26:35.147Z","cooked":"

On the driver station, the console window should show some ping messages like so

Furthermore, the 2nd tab shows us more info.

Can you send us a picture of this? It can tell us where in the chain something is not working.
I agree more with what Nathan said above. Constantly repeating code crashes can typically result in comms not showing up.
